meanings.definition: A person or thing that inflates.
meanings.sent1: The tire inflator quickly filled the flat tire with air.
meanings.sent2: The birthday party inflator blew up colorful balloons for the celebration.
meanings.sent3: The bubblegum inflator accidentally made the bubble so big it covered the whole face!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an inflator, filling the room with joy and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The hot air inflator made the hot air balloon rise gracefully into the sky.

meanings.definition: A device used to inflate something.
meanings.sent1: The air mattress inflator made setting up the bed easy and quick.
meanings.sent2: The pool inflator helped blow up the pool float for a fun day in the water.
meanings.sent3: The beach ball inflator looked like a small, colorful vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: His words were like an emotional inflator, pumping up the crowd with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The bike tire inflator was essential for keeping the tires at the right pressure for a smooth ride.

meanings.definition: A substance used to inflate something.
meanings.sent1: The helium inflator was used to fill the balloons for the party.
meanings.sent2: The foam inflator expanded to fill the gaps in the wall insulation.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn inflator made the kernels pop into fluffy, delicious snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as an emotional inflator, lifting the spirits of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The yeast inflator caused the bread dough to rise and become fluffy when baked.
